full_summary:
===============

* Title: Capital Interpretation and Commemoration - Banners & Exhibits Installation, Maintenance, and Removal
* Reference Number: cb-715-24111638
* Solicitation Number: 10233244
* Publication Date: June 12, 2024
* Tender Closing Date: June 27, 2024 2:00 PM EDT

* Description of Requirement:

The Department of Canadian Heritage, Capital Interpretation and Commemoration Section, requires the services of a contractor with resources certified for working at heights and trained in operating lifting devices such as bucket trucks, booms, or small cranes, and forklifts, for the transportation, installation, maintenance, and removal of banners and exhibits along Confederation Boulevard or the National Capital Region's core area.

The contract duration is from July 1, 2024, to March 31, 2025, with the option to extend for up to four additional one-year periods under the same conditions.

* Evaluation Process and Selection Methodology:

The proposal will be evaluated based on the following mandatory technical criteria:

1.  **Installation, Removal, and Maintenance of Banners**: The contractor must have at least five years of experience in the installation, removal, and maintenance of banners. The contractor must provide two project descriptions completed within the last five years demonstrating experience in banner installation, removal, and maintenance.
2.  **Installation, Removal, and Maintenance of Exhibits and Exhibit Structures**: The contractor must provide at least one but no more than three project descriptions demonstrating experience in exhibit and exhibit structure installations.
3.  **Emergency Response Plan**: The contractor must have a plan to respond to emergency calls from the Project Authority within four hours of the initial call.

* Contact Information:

The contract entity is the Department of Canadian Heritage, Capital Interpretation and Commemoration Section, located at 200 Sacre-Coeur Boulevard, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0H3. The contact person is Natou Barry at (343) 575-2233 or by email at contrats-contracting@pch.gc.ca.

Note: This is a Request for Proposal under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA). Bidders must be able to provide proof of certification for working at heights and experience in operating lifting devices. The contract will be awarded to the bidder with the lowest evaluated price who meets the mandatory technical criteria.

No Attachments were provided. Appendices and the Request for Proposal can be found on the Canada Buy Service
